skill.name: fluidsim
skill.description: Framework for computational fluid dynamics simulations using Python. Use when running fluid dynamics simulations including Navier-Stokes equations (2D/3D), shallow water equations, stratified flows, or when analyzing turbulence, vortex dynamics, or geophysical flows. Provides pseudospectral methods with FFT, HPC support, and comprehensive output analysis.

skill.author: K-Dense Inc.

security_audit.summary: Documentation-only skill containing markdown files with code examples for the FluidSim Python library. No executable scripts, network calls, file system access, or command execution. Pure educational content.

content.value_statement: Computational fluid dynamics simulations require precise solver selection and parameter configuration. This skill provides step-by-step guidance for installing FluidSim, configuring 2D and 3D Navier-Stokes simulations, and analyzing turbulence and spectral outputs.
actual_capabilities: Explain installation options including FFT and MPI extras
Guide parameter configuration for resolution, viscosity, and time stepping
Outline workflows to run 2D and 3D Navier-Stokes simulations
Describe analysis of fields, spectra, and spatial means outputs
Show how to restart from saved state files
Configure custom forcing and initial conditions
limitations: Requires the FluidSim Python package to be installed separately
Focuses on periodic-domain pseudospectral solvers only
Does not provide mesh-based or non-periodic boundary solvers
No built-in visualization beyond documented matplotlib plotting calls

output: Recommended solver: ns3d for 3D turbulence simulation

Analyze energy spectra and spatial means after completion using built-in plotting

best_practices: Use power-of-two grid sizes for optimal FFT performance
Enable CFL-based adaptive time stepping for numerical stability
Save spectra and spatial means at sensible intervals to balance storage and analysis needs
anti_patterns: Running large simulations without FFT libraries properly installed
Using incorrect parameter names that cause AttributeError exceptions
Saving physical fields at every time step for high-resolution large runs

faq.question: Is this skill compatible with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code?
faq.answer: Yes. The documentation and examples work across all these AI platforms without modification.

faq.question: What are the main limits of this skill?
faq.answer: It provides guidance for FluidSim workflows only and does not add new solvers or features to the library.

faq.question: Can it integrate with my HPC cluster workflow?
faq.answer: Yes. Documentation includes MPI configuration and cluster submission patterns for FluidSim.

faq.question: Does this skill access or send my data?
faq.answer: No. The skill contains only documentation and performs no data access or network communication.

faq.question: What if my simulation fails to start?
faq.answer: Verify FFT and MPI dependencies are installed, then check parameters and output paths for errors.

faq.question: How does it compare to general CFD references?
faq.answer: This skill is specific to FluidSim parameters and workflows, not a general computational fluid dynamics tutorial.
